q: House and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. We encourage an open exchange of affirming and dissenting opinions on our stories. We invite

"Every athlete has a coach," Eric Schmidt rationalizes very confidently, and adds, People are never good at seeing themselves as others see them... a coach help's you see what you've been missing. Google's revenue in 2010 is estimated to be about$ 30 billion, which is about 25% increase from 2009. Evidently, Boss Schmidt has figured out how to be an extraordinary leader.

their views on Google's business practices by February 11. The Commission is expected to take several months to digest the feedback. Google on Monday reiterated that it was co-operating with the regulator. There's always going to be room for improvement, so we'll be working with the Commission to address any concerns, spokesman Al Verney said.
